data.title: Princes of Brazil - Afonso VI of Portugal, Prince Pedro Luis of Orleans-Braganza, Prince Pedro Gastao of Orleans-Braganza, Peter II of Portugal (Paperback)
data.meta_description: Chapters: Afonso Vi of Portugal, Prince Pedro Luis of Orleans-Braganza, Prince Pedro Gastao of Orleans-Braganza, Peter Ii of Portugal, Prince Pedro Henrique of Orleans-Braganza, Prince Luis of Orleans-Braganza, Prince Antonio of Orleans-Braganza, Prince Pedro Carlos of Orleans-Braganza, Prince Luis Gastao of Orleans-Braganza, Prince Pedro Thiago of Orleans-Braganza, Prince Rafael of Orleans-Braganza, Teodosio, Prince of Brazil, Prince Eudes Maria of Orleans-Braganza. Source: Wikipedia. Pages: 48. Not illustrated. Free updates online. Purchase includes a free trial membership in the publisher's book club where you can select from more than a million books without charge. Excerpt: Prince Pedro Luis of Orleans-Braganza (Dom Pedro Luis Maria Jose Miguel Gabriel Rafael Gonzaga de Orleans-Braganca e Ligne; (English: Peter Louis Mary Joseph Michael Gabriel Raphael Gonzaga of Orleans-Braganza and Ligne) (12 January 1983 1 June 2009) was the son of Prince Antonio of Orleans-Braganza, and was expected to eventually inherit the position of pretender to the former imperial crown of Brazil. For monarchists, Prince Pedro Luis was third in the line of succession to the Brazilian throne, abolished in 1889. The current pretender and head of the former dynasty is his childless uncle, Prince Luis. First in line of succession is another childless uncle, Prince Bertrand, and his own father, Prince Antonio, is second in the line of succession. His younger brother, Prince Rafael, replaces him in the line of succession upon legal declaration of his death, which occurred on Air France Flight 447. He was born on 12 January 1983 in Rio de Janeiro, the elder of the two sons of the Brazilian Prince Antonio and his Belgian wife, Princess Christine de Ligne. His paternal grandparents were Pedro Henrique, head of the Brazilian Imperial House and of Princess Maria Elisabeth of Bavaria.
